<a href="https://www.seavees.com/pages/welcome-morning-brew-reader?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=paidcontent&utm_campaign=primarysponsorship" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="SeaVees" style="width:100%;max-width: 146px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="146" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby8zNi8xNjE2NzA3MDgzLVNjcmVlbl9TaG90XzIwMjEtMDMtMjVfYXRfNS4xNy4zOV9QTS5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJjb21ldC1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19"></a>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong data-stringify-type="bold" style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>In the latest edition of #brandfails, Volkswagen said it <em data-stringify-type="italic">wasn’t </em>changing the name of its US division to “Voltswagen” after all, admitting that its Tuesday announcement was just an April Fools' joke to promote its new SUV, even though everyone believed it. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span class="c-mrkdwn__br" data-stringify-type="paragraph-break"></span>The lesson? April Fools' isn’t like Halloween or your most popular friend’s birthday...it doesn’t last an entire week.</p>
</td>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/30/cameo-becomes-unicorn?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Cameo Makes an Appearance
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/30/cameo-becomes-unicorn" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Gilbert Gottfried cameo" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NTY1L2dpbGJlcnRfZ290dGZyaWVkX2NhbWVvLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Cameo</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Getting Gilbert Gottfried to roast your friends is priceless. Cameo, the platform that allows users to do just that, is not. Cameo is now valued at <a href="https://variety.com/2021/digital/news/cameo-raises-100-million-amazon-google-uta-1234940598/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$1 billion</a> after raising $100 million in Series C funding yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's cantering with a growing herd of unicorns that focus on getting content from creators → fans with the least amount of friction possible. That herd really picked up the pace yesterday, because in addition to Cameo…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Substack</strong></span><span>, a paid newsletter platform, is </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/substack-andreessen-horowitz-newsletter-36cb98ea-a7b3-43b1-883a-fa45586eaad4.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raising $65 million</a></span><span> from venture capital firms at a valuation nearing $650 million, according to Axios. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Unsplash</strong></span><span>, a site full of fledgling photographers' stock images, </span><span><a href="https://petapixel.com/2021/03/30/unsplash-is-being-acquired-by-getty-images/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">was acquired</a></span><span> by Getty Images, its bigger and more expensive rival. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Betty Labs</strong></span><span>, which runs a Clubhouse-for-sports live audio platform called Locker Room, was </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/30/spotify-acquires-betty-labs-maker-of-live-audio-app-locker-room.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">acquired by Spotify</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What's causing the "creator economy" to swell?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Platforms like Cameo and Substack were already getting more popular as fans sought out a more direct connection with creators, but the pandemic made backstage content = all content. Deprived of new movies and bored of baking sourdough, more people gravitated online to connect with their increasingly accessible idols. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And as the financials for these companies show, cutting out the legacy media middleman means more money for everyone else...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Patreon, which lets fans pay for bespoke creator content, became a unicorn last year. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Also in 2020, the similar-but-significantly-more-NSFW platform OnlyFans made </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/18/onlyfans-makes-money-moves-amid-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$300 million in profit</a></span><span> on $400 million in revenue, per The Information.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Cameo said it made $100 million in gross revenue last year and left a lot more than chump change on the table for creators, 150+ of whom made more than $100,000. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>this story could only culminate in crypto land. Dapper Labs, the company that created the NFT marketplace NBA Top Shot, wrapped up a <a href="https://ca.finance.yahoo.com/news/dapper-labs-creators-nba-top-130339401.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$305 million</a> financing round yesterday, raising its valuation to $2.6 billion. The company's success represents yet another trendy way for creators, like artists or musicians, to monetize their work—by minting it as an NFT (non-fungible token). </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/30/amazon-unionization-vote-heres-watch?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Somebody Call Steve Kornacki
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There's a close race to follow in Bessemer, AL, that <a href="https://apnews.com/article/amazon-union-vote-alabama-747ea42198655bfbca000c2e0665c3ae?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">decides</a> whether or not 6,000 Amazon warehouse workers unionize. But like "election night" 2020, the count may take several days.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The country is watching</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Organizers want the Bessemer workers to join the Retail, Wholesale, and Department Store Union, which helps members bargain for better pay and working conditions. High-profile figures ranging from <a href="https://www.vice.com/en/article/m7axzn/nfl-players-endorse-amazon-warehouse-workers-unionization?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NFL athletes</a> to <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/03/01/972410944/biden-backs-amazon-warehouse-workers-union-drive?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the president</a> have voiced support. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Organizers have tied the rhetoric of their campaign to the civil rights movement. An estimated 80% of the warehouse's workers are Black. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Amazon's response: </strong>It raised its minimum wage to $15/hour—twice the minimum required in Alabama—a couple years ago. Plus, workers already get healthcare, vision, and dental benefits without paying union dues. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Both sides can challenge whether the vote was conducted fairly. Union organizers may bring up Amazon's anti-union messaging campaign at the warehouse, which even followed workers <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2021/02/02/amazon-union-warehouse-workers/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">into the bathroom</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> This isn't about just one Amazon warehouse. After decades of waning union participation, organizers hope this vote sparks "an explosion of union organizing across the country." </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REAL ESTATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/30/us-home-prices-hit-7year-high?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Prepare for a Backlog of Housewarming Parties
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/30/us-home-prices-hit-7year-high" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="housing market " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMDYvaG91c2luZ19tYXJrZXQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Americans have made good on their New Year's resolutions to finally get their own place. A little too good. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">US home prices <a href="https://apnews.com/article/financial-markets-home-prices-prices-coronavirus-pandemic-5f01185ee13a69234972f13179896a2f?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">soared</a> 11.2% annually in January—the biggest annual gain since 2006, according to the S&P CoreLogic Case-Shiller national index. Phoenix (+15.8%), Seattle (+14.3%), and San Diego (+14.2%) led the cities surveyed. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It's not so buyers can make it in time for mulching season</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The pandemic and low borrowing costs are still pushing buyers out of urban apartments and into the suburbs. But as the pool of would-be buyers has grown, supply's gotten tighter than a Lower East Side kitchen: In February, available homes fell by nearly a third to just over 1 million. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some experts think rising mortgage rates could cool the market. As Treasury yields move higher, the average rate on a 30-year fixed mortgage is now at 3.2%, up from historic lows last year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>At some point the market will slow down...but experts aren't sure when. Until that happens, we're quitting the newsletter biz and going to build some houses.  </p>

<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Last year, almost 65% of Google searches ended without a click to another web property, according to a study by SimilarWeb. The numbers provide <a href="https://searchengineland.com/zero-click-google-searches-rose-to-nearly-65-in-2020-347115?utm_source=Benedict%27s+Newsletter&utm_campaign=2ae7ca7754-Benedict%27s+newsletter_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4999ca107f-2ae7ca7754-70650345&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more ammo</a> to critics of Google's ability to control search results, but it also reflects the rise in mobile browsing, where clicking out is less common.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>"As far as WHO is concerned, all hypotheses remain on the table."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said an investigation into Covid-19's origins (conducted by the WHO, by the way) did not sufficiently look into the possibility of the virus being leaked by a lab. The US and 13 other countries have also <a href="https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2021/3/30/fourteen-countries-raise-concern-over-who-report-covid-origin?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bashed the report</a>, which concluded that bat → another animal → humans was the likeliest cause of the initial outbreak. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The therapy-app fantasy. (<a href="https://www.thecut.com/article/mental-health-therapy-apps.html?utm_source=pocket&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=pockethits&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Cut</a>)</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EXPLAINER
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/30/reader-qa-financial-leverage?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Reader Q&A: Leverage at First Sight
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Leverage cartoon" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=342 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/14rfBl2RMAHtCM/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Leverage cartoon" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/14rfBl2RMAHtCM/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Only the best animated movie ever, <em>The Emperor's New Groove</em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Jane from Seattle's Q: </strong>I've been hearing the word "leverage" in this story about the hedge fund that blew up. Can you explain what that is? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The Brew's A: </strong>The concept of leverage in finance is similar to the concept of leverage <em>outside</em> of finance. Their origins lie in the lever, a machine that requires you to only apply a little effort to generate a lot of force. Levers in the physical world include scissors, bottle openers, and baseball bats. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the financial world, investors use the term "leverage" to refer to debt that's used to fund transactions. The idea is to borrow money to make purchases that, over time, can make you far more money than your initial capital could. In other words, if you want to hit a ball 300 yards, you need a golf club instead of a soup spoon.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But while leverage can increase your reward, it can also increase risk, which is where the story of this hedge fund, Archegos Capital Management, comes in. Archegos used a tool called "swaps" to build large positions in stocks without providing lots of money up-front. Last week, that strategy backfired in spectacular fashion when those stock prices fell, and the banks that lent Archegos the money sold tens of billions worth of shares, deepening the pain. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For more on this saga, our video guy Dan Toomey put together a <a href="https://www.tiktok.com/@morning_brew/video/6945540157584051462?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hilarious clip</a> explaining what happened. </p>

The good news is that the fallout from the collapse of Archegos Capital Management has not vibrated across the markets as feared.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEconomy:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Consumer confidence hit a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/consumer-confidence-surges-in-march-to-a-pandemic-high-as-economy-speeds-up-11617113162?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eone-year high\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in March with help from the most recent round of $1,400 stimulus checks and vaccines. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eCameo\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGetting Gilbert Gottfried to roast your friends is priceless. Cameo, the platform that allows users to do just that, is not. Cameo is now valued at \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2021/digital/news/cameo-raises-100-million-amazon-google-uta-1234940598/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$1 billion\u003c/a\u003e after raising $100 million in Series C funding yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt's cantering with a growing herd of unicorns that focus on getting content from creators → fans with the least amount of friction possible. That herd really picked up the pace yesterday, because in addition to Cameo…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSubstack\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, a paid newsletter platform, is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/substack-andreessen-horowitz-newsletter-36cb98ea-a7b3-43b1-883a-fa45586eaad4.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraising $65 million\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e from venture capital firms at a valuation nearing $650 million, according to Axios. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eUnsplash\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, a site full of fledgling photographers' stock images, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://petapixel.com/2021/03/30/unsplash-is-being-acquired-by-getty-images/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewas acquired\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e by Getty Images, its bigger and more expensive rival. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBetty Labs\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, which runs a Clubhouse-for-sports live audio platform called Locker Room, was \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/30/spotify-acquires-betty-labs-maker-of-live-audio-app-locker-room.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eacquired by Spotify\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat's causing the \"creator economy\" to swell?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlatforms like Cameo and Substack were already getting more popular as fans sought out a more direct connection with creators, but the pandemic made backstage content = all content. Deprived of new movies and bored of baking sourdough, more people gravitated online to connect with their increasingly accessible idols. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd as the financials for these companies show, cutting out the legacy media middleman means more money for everyone else...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePatreon, which lets fans pay for bespoke creator content, became a unicorn last year. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAlso in 2020, the similar-but-significantly-more-NSFW platform OnlyFans made \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/18/onlyfans-makes-money-moves-amid-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$300 million in profit\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on $400 million in revenue, per The Information.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCameo said it made $100 million in gross revenue last year and left a lot more than chump change on the table for creators, 150+ of whom made more than $100,000. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethis story could only culminate in crypto land. Dapper Labs, the company that created the NFT marketplace NBA Top Shot, wrapped up a \u003ca href=\"https://ca.finance.yahoo.com/news/dapper-labs-creators-nba-top-130339401.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$305 million\u003c/a\u003e financing round yesterday, raising its valuation to $2.6 billion. The company's success represents yet another trendy way for creators, like artists or musicians, to monetize their work—by minting it as an NFT (non-fungible token). \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nSomebody Call Steve Kornacki\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere's a close race to follow in Bessemer, AL, that \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/amazon-union-vote-alabama-747ea42198655bfbca000c2e0665c3ae?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edecides\u003c/a\u003e whether or not 6,000 Amazon warehouse workers unionize. But like \"election night\" 2020, the count may take several days.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe country is watching\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOrganizers want the Bessemer workers to join the Retail, Wholesale, and Department Store Union, which helps members bargain for better pay and working conditions. High-profile figures ranging from \u003ca href=\"https://www.vice.com/en/article/m7axzn/nfl-players-endorse-amazon-warehouse-workers-unionization?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNFL athletes\u003c/a\u003e to \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/03/01/972410944/biden-backs-amazon-warehouse-workers-union-drive?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe president\u003c/a\u003e have voiced support. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOrganizers have tied the rhetoric of their campaign to the civil rights movement. An estimated 80% of the warehouse's workers are Black. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAmazon's response: \u003c/strong\u003eIt raised its minimum wage to $15/hour—twice the minimum required in Alabama—a couple years ago. Plus, workers already get healthcare, vision, and dental benefits without paying union dues. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBoth sides can challenge whether the vote was conducted fairly. Union organizers may bring up Amazon's anti-union messaging campaign at the warehouse, which even followed workers \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2021/02/02/amazon-union-warehouse-workers/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einto the bathroom\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e This isn't about just one Amazon warehouse. After decades of waning union participation, organizers hope this vote sparks \"an explosion of union organizing across the country.\" \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAmericans have made good on their New Year's resolutions to finally get their own place. Phoenix (+15.8%), Seattle (+14.3%), and San Diego (+14.2%) led the cities surveyed. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt's not so buyers can make it in time for mulching season\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe pandemic and low borrowing costs are still pushing buyers out of urban apartments and into the suburbs. But as the pool of would-be buyers has grown, supply's gotten tighter than a Lower East Side kitchen: In February, available homes fell by nearly a third to just over 1 million. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome experts think rising mortgage rates could cool the market. As Treasury yields move higher, the average rate on a 30-year fixed mortgage is now at 3.2%, up from historic lows last year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eAt some point the market will slow down...but experts aren't sure when. another web property, according to a study by SimilarWeb. The numbers provide \u003ca href=\"https://searchengineland.com/zero-click-google-searches-rose-to-nearly-65-in-2020-347115?utm_source=Benedict%27s+Newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=2ae7ca7754-Benedict%27s+newsletter_COPY_01\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_term=0_4999ca107f-2ae7ca7754-70650345\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore ammo\u003c/a\u003e to critics of Google's ability to control search results, but it also reflects the rise in mobile browsing, where clicking out is less common.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eQuote: \u003c/strong\u003e\"As far as WHO is concerned, all hypotheses remain on the table.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said an investigation into Covid-19's origins (conducted by the WHO, by the way) did not sufficiently look into the possibility of the virus being leaked by a lab. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eOnly the best animated movie ever, \u003cem\u003eThe Emperor's New Groove\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eJane from Seattle's Q: \u003c/strong\u003eI've been hearing the word \"leverage\" in this story about the hedge fund that blew up. Can you explain what that is? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe Brew's A: \u003c/strong\u003eThe concept of leverage in finance is similar to the concept of leverage \u003cem\u003eoutside\u003c/em\u003e of finance. Their origins lie in the lever, a machine that requires you to only apply a little effort to generate a lot of force. Levers in the physical world include scissors, bottle openers, and baseball bats. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the financial world, investors use the term \"leverage\" to refer to debt that's used to fund transactions. The idea is to borrow money to make purchases that, over time, can make you far more money than your initial capital could. In other words, if you want to hit a ball 300 yards, you need a golf club instead of a soup spoon.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut while leverage can increase your reward, it can also increase risk, which is where the story of this hedge fund, Archegos Capital Management, comes in. Archegos used a tool called \"swaps\" to build large positions in stocks without providing lots of money up-front. Last week, that strategy backfired in spectacular fashion when those stock prices fell, and the banks that lent Archegos the money sold tens of billions worth of shares, deepening the pain. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor more on this saga, our video guy Dan Toomey put together a \u003ca href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@morning_brew/video/6945540157584051462?lang=en\u0026is_copy_url=1\u0026is_from_webapp=v1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehilarious clip\u003c/a\u003e explaining what happened. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable
